content: top or leave it open and insert some chimney smoke embroidery the spots are made with french knots i recommend worsted as sock yarn is so thin that it often pulls back into the fabric and gets lost so you don t run out of yarn half way through cut a piece of yarn at least 30 /76 cm long for the french knots when done hide the ends inside of stem the door is made using satin stitch it is about 2 sts wide and 6 sts high see pg 2 if desired add a horizontal stitch on the top and bottom try not to stitch the 2 sides together the door knob can be made with a french knot i used sock yarn hide ends inside of stem stuffing to stuff your mushroom push some stuffing up into the top of your mushroom through the bottom hole i like to push it in with my thumb don t stuff the cap too much or it will be top heavy i like to make my stem firm with lots of stuffing thanks/pattern support thanks for knitting one of my designs i hope you had fun for pattern support just pm me on ravelry 4 porcini instructions using your cap color cast on 8 sts leaving a long tail for closing the hole in finishing divide the sts over 2 dpns and join to work in the round round 1 knit round 2 kfb repeat until end of round 16 sts redistribute the sts on to 3 dpns needle 1 now has 4 sts and needle 2 & 3 now has 6 sts each you may want to add a stitch marker to show where round begins round 3 k1 kfb repeat until end of round 24 sts round 4 k2 kfb repeat until end of round 32 sts round 5 k3 kfb repeat until end of round 40 sts stitch count check in needle 1 should have 10 sts needle 2 & 3 should have 15 sts each round 6-12 k4 p1 repeat until end of round round 13 ssk k2tog p1 repeat until end of round 24 sts redistribute the sts needle 1 now has 12 sts and needle 2 & 3 now has 6 sts each change to white color round 14 knit round 15 purl round 16 knit round 17 ssk ssk k4 k2tog k2tog repeat 16 sts round 18-21 knit round 22 k1 m1r k6 m1l k1 repeat 20 sts round 23-24 knit round 25 k1 m1r k8 m1l k1 repeat 24 sts round 26-27 knit round 28 k1 m1r k10 m1l k1 repeat 28 sts round 29-30 knit change to grass or earth color round 31-32 knit round 33 purl round 34 knit round 35 ssk ssk k6 k2tog k2tog repeat 20 sts round 36 knit cast off tidy up hole while weaving in end hole remains open finishing weave in ends make sure all ends are weaved in or hidden inside your mushroom
